results.title: Vanuatu
results.creator_credit: Denmark, U-V Film and Video and Leif Stubkjaer,
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Oceans of Dreams - Currents of Change Series”.
A look at contemporary Vanuatu with its contrasts of almost undisturbed traditional areas, to the sophisticated capital, Port Vila.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denmark, U-V Film and Video and Leif Stubkjaer,

results.title: Kiribati
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Oceans of Dreams - Currents of Change Series”.
Kiribati becomes an independent nation in 1979. The Republic comprises 33 coral atolls, formerly the Gilbert, Phoenix and Line Island groups. The atolls are often no more than a few metres above sea level, extremely narrow and with scant soil and surface water. Kiribati’s 719 square kilometres must support a population of approximately 65,000. What the land lacks in natural resources is compensated for by a vast ocean economic zone (3 million square kilometres), straddling the equator and stretching from near Hawaii in the North to Tuvala and Fiji in the south. The film looks at contemporary and traditional life, the challenges and changes which this Republic faces today.

results.title: Cook Islands
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Oceans of Dreams - Currents of Change Series”.
The Cook Islands are a collection of small coral atolls spread over a vast area of the South Pacific Ocean. They are inhabited by Polynesian Maoris who are closely linked to New Zealand Maoris. The Cook Islands’ other links with New Zealand are economic and political. Once a protectorate of New Zealand, the Cook Islands are now self-governing but their people are citizens of New Zealand. More of them now live there than in their home islands. A cultural renaissance is taking place in the Cooks, partly encouraged by tourism, the education system and by the wishes of the people. This is but one of the issues and changes which the film examines in a contemporary account of life in these islands.

results.title: Keating on Restoration
results.creator_credit: Richard Beighton, Richard Fawkes, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating, an English artist and television personality, demonstrates the art of restoring an old painting. He collects a century old “pot boiler” from his local pub and explains in detail the restoration process.

results.title: Keating on Van Gogh
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating, creates a composite picture in the style of Van Gogh and includes a portrait of the artist and sunflowers in the painting. He provides biographical details of Van Gogh, describes his physical appearance and the influence on his paintings of the Dutch Masters.

results.title: Keating on Monet
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating recreates a river-side scene in winter using Monet painting techniques. Monet often worked on the River Seine in his painting boat. Keating provides biographical details, discusses his painter colleagues and their support of each other, his poverty and the difficulties in painting nature.

results.title: Keating on Manet
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating recreates the Manet painting “Olympia”, providing short biographical details, explaining the confident way in which he painted, expressing form very simply and juxtaposing warm and cool in his compositions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Renoir
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating paints a portrait using an artist’s model as his subject. He discusses Renoir’s limited palette, his influences and his eventual creation of a unique style of painting together with biographical details.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Constable
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating, art forger explains how Constable always initiated his work from a black and white sketch, working on this to produce his final work. He examines “The Hay Wain” describing Constable’s use of shading techniques and his love of greys. Keating explains how Constable was never afraid to paint over yesterday’s work and suggests that Constable, although a rapid worker, would repaint until satisfied.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
